intro: Townsendia sericea, commonly known as silky Townsend’s gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves, which give it a silvery appearance. Townsendia sericea is often found at higher elevations and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
